GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "6 Month Drug Study".

ItemGroupDef.Name: Prior to today's treatment, please respond to the following health questionnaire:
Please respond to the following health questionnaire:

Question.TranslatedText: Record ID
Patient ID:
Age Range:
Patient Sex:
Any chance of currently being pregnant?
Do you have a regular, monthly menstrual cycle?
First day of last menstrual cycle:
History of Smoking?
Current Smoker (within last 4 months)?
Does medical history include any of the following major diseases? Check all that apply.
Does medical history include any of the following major diseases? Check all that apply.
Does medical history include any of the following major diseases? Check all that apply.
Does medical history include any of the following major diseases? Check all that apply.
Does medical history include any of the following major diseases? Check all that apply.

The purpose of this form is to obtain authorized consent and patient health information under the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA) for participation in GHealth Pharmaceuticals' clinical trials testing XYZ drug.
I declare the information provided to be true and consent to GHealth Pharmaceuticals verifying with other sources all information that I have provided in this application.
I understand that completing this form does not guarantee my participation in the study. I understand that I have a right to withdraw from this study at any point by consulting the healthcare professional assigned to me.
I consent to the above.
Patient Signature
Date of Signature
Complete?
Patient ID:
Has the patient previously completed a consent form?
Treatment Date:

ItemData.Value: this study was looking at pills for improved digestion and fibre intake
gave options for morning and evening treatment meetings, which was convenient for working people
regular reminders of 1 week, 2 days, 2 hours leading up to treatment dates were good, not too frequent
The increased bowel movements during the study have become normal again
patient diagnosed with anal fungal infection, is now on topical antifungal medication for 2 weeks ending 15-03-2025.
studying a medication for increased fibre uptake
pills are large and get stuck in throat. maybe make them slimmer
staff took a long time to return calls but respond to emails within 24 hours. it would be better if you clarified that emails are preferred.
patient had a minor car accident, suffered minor scratches to the face and bruising on the left arm. no concussion. was not prescribed anything.
